action.action-desc: Mr. Brown (for himself, Mr. Durbin, Mr. Reid, Mr. Schumer, Mrs. Murray, Mr. Wyden, Ms. Stabenow, Mr. Casey, Mr. Carper, Ms. Cantwell, Mr. Bennet, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Cardin, Mr. Nelson, Mr. Warner, Mr. King, Mr. Tester, Mr. Sanders, Mr. Booker, Ms. Klobuchar, Mr. Peters, Mr. Merkley, Mr. Markey, Mrs. Boxer, Ms. Warren, Mr. Whitehouse, Mr. Coons, Mr. Franken, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Reed, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Udall, Mr. Leahy, Mrs. Shaheen, Mr. Heinrich, Mr. Murphy, Ms. Baldwin, Ms. Heitkamp, Ms. Mikulski, Mr. Kaine, Mrs. Feinstein, and Mrs. McCaskill) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to strengthen the earned income tax credit and make permanent certain tax provisions under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Working Families Tax Relief Act of 2015.

section.header: Permanent extension of and modifications to the child tax credit

subsection.header: Permanent extension of increase in refundable portion

paragraph.text: Clause (i) of section 24(d)(1)(B) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $10,000 and inserting $3,000.
Subsection (d) of section 24 of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (4).
Subsection (d) of section 24 of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (3).

subsection.text: Section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: In the case of any taxable year beginning in a calendar year after 2014, the $1,000 amount in subsection (a) and each of the dollar amounts in subsection (b)(2) shall each be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins, determined by substituting calendar year 2011 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

paragraph.text: Any increase determined under the preceding sentence shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $50.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Permanent extension of modifications to earned income tax credit

subsection.header: Increase in credit percentage for families with 3 or more children
subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 32(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The credit and inserting the following:
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Increased credit percentage for families with 3 or more qualifying children
subparagraph.text: In the case of an eligible individual with 3 or more qualifying children, the table in subparagraph (A) shall be applied by substituting 45 for 40 in the second column thereof.

paragraph.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 32(b)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $3,000 and inserting $5,000..
Clause (ii) of section 32(j)(1)(B) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (b)(2)(B)(iii) and inserting subsection (b)(2)(B), and
by striking calendar year 2007 and inserting calendar year 2008.

subsection.text: Section 32(b)of such Code is amended by striking paragraph (3).
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Strengthening the earned income tax credit

subsection.header: Increased credit for individuals with no qualifying children

paragraph.text: The table in subparagraph (A) of section 32(b)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking $4,220 in the second column and inserting $8,820, and
by striking $5,280 in the last column and inserting $10,425.

paragraph.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 32(j)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended by this Act, is amended—

clause.text: by inserting (except as provided in clause (iii)) after (b)(2)(A), and
by striking and at the end, and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following new clause:

clause.text: in the case of the $8,820 and $10,4250 amount in the table in subsection (b)(2)(A), by substituting calendar year 2011 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) of such section 1.

subsection.header: Credit increase and reduction in phaseout for individuals with no children
subsection.text: The table contained in section 32(b)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended by this Act, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking 7.65 in the second column of the third row and inserting 15.3, and
by striking 7.65 in the third column of the third row and inserting 15.3.

subsection.header: Credit allowed for certain childless individuals over age 21
subsection.text: Subclause (II) of section 32(c)(1)(A)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking age 25 and inserting age 21.
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.header: Simplifying the earned income tax credit

paragraph.text: Section 32(c)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this section, an individual who—

clause.text: is married (within the meaning of section 7703(a)) and files a separate return for the taxable year,
lives with a qualifying child of the individual for more than one-half of such taxable year, and

subclause.text: during the last 6 months of such taxable year, does not have the same principal place of abode as the individual's spouse, or
has a legally binding separation agreement with the individual’s spouse and is not a member of the same household with the individual’s spouse by the end of the taxable year,

subparagraph.continuation-text: shall not be considered as married.

subparagraph.text: The last sentence of section 32(c)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking section 7703 and inserting section 7703(a).

Section 32(d) of such Code is amended by striking In the case of an individual who is married (within the meaning of section 7703) and inserting In the case of an individual who is married (within the meaning of section 7703(a)) and is not described in subsection (c)(1)(G).

subsection.header: Elimination of disqualified investment income test

paragraph.text: Section 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking subsection (i).

subparagraph.text: Section 32(j)(1)(B)(i) of such Code, as amended by this Act, is amended—

clause.text: by striking subsections and inserting subsection, and

subparagraph.text: Section 32(j)(2) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: If any dollar amount in subsection (b)(2)(A) (after being increased under subparagraph (B) thereof), after being increased under paragraph (1), is not a multiple of $10, such amount shall be rounded to the next nearest multiple of $10.

subsection.header: Simplification of rules regarding presence of qualifying child

paragraph.header: Taxpayer eligible for credit for worker without qualifying child if qualifying child claimed by another member of family
paragraph.text: Section 32(c)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended by this Act, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.header: Taxpayer eligible for credit for worker without qualifying child if qualifying child claimed by another member of family

clause.text: Except as provided in clause (ii), in the case of 2 or more eligible individuals who may claim for such taxable year the same individual as a qualifying child, if such individual is claimed as a qualifying child by such an eligible individual, then any other such eligible individual who does not make such a claim of such child or of any other qualifying child may be considered an eligible individual without a qualifying child for purposes of the credit allowed under this section for such taxable year.

clause.header: Exception if qualifying child claimed by parent
clause.text: If an individual is claimed as a qualifying child for any taxable year by an eligible individual who is a parent of such child, then no other custodial parent of such child who does not make such a claim of such child may be considered an eligible individual without a qualifying child for purposes of the credit allowed under this section for such taxable year.

paragraph.header: Taxpayer eligible for credit for worker without qualifying child if qualifying children do not have valid social security number
paragraph.text: Subparagraph (F) of section 32(c)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.header: Individuals who do not include tin, etc., of any qualifying child
subparagraph.text: In the case of any eligible individual who has one or more qualifying children, if no qualifying child of such individual is taken into account under subsection (b) by reason of paragraph (3)(D), for purposes of the credit allowed under this section, such individual may be considered an eligible individual without a qualifying child.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
